items.title: Awesome Flutter
items.content_text:
### Testing / Redux / ELM / Dependency Injection

*   [Patrol (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/leancodepl/patrol) <!--stargazers:leancodepl/patrol--> - Easy-to-learn, powerful UI testing framework eliminating limitations of `flutter_test`, `integration_test`, and `flutter_driver` by [LeanCode](https://leancode.co)
items.content_html:
Testing / Redux / ELM / Dependency Injection

items.title: Awesome Crypto Papers
items.content_text:
### Introducing people to data security and cryptography / Brief introductions

*   [An Overview of Cryptography](http://web.archive.org/web/20220918232416/https://www.garykessler.net/library/crypto.html) - By Gary C. Kessler.

### Specific topics / Public key cryptography: Elliptic-curve crypto

*   [Biased Nonce Sense: Lattice Attacks against Weak ECDSA Signatures in Cryptocurrencies](https://eprint.iacr.org/2019/023.pdf) - Computing private keys by analyzing and exploiting biases in ECDSA nonces.
*   [Minerva: The curse of ECDSA nonces](https://eprint.iacr.org/2020/728.pdf) - Exploiting timing/bit-length leaks for recovering private keys from ECDSA signatures
*   [LadderLeak: Breaking ECDSA With Less Than One Bit Of Nonce Leakage](https://eprint.iacr.org/2020/615.pdf) - Breaking 160-bit curve ECDSA using less than one bit leakage.
items.content_html:
Introducing people to data security and cryptography / Brief introductions

  • An Overview of Cryptography - By Gary C. Kessler.

Specific topics / Public key cryptography: Elliptic-curve crypto

  • Biased Nonce Sense: Lattice Attacks against Weak ECDSA Signatures in Cryptocurrencies - Computing private keys by analyzing and exploiting biases in ECDSA nonces.
  • Minerva: The curse of ECDSA nonces - Exploiting timing/bit-length leaks for recovering private keys from ECDSA signatures
  • LadderLeak: Breaking ECDSA With Less Than One Bit Of Nonce Leakage - Breaking 160-bit curve ECDSA using less than one bit leakage.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [lpha3cho (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/sdcampbell/lpha3cho-Oh-My-Zsh-theme-for-pentesters) - Modified version of the [intheloop (‚≠ê180k)](https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/blob/master/themes/intheloop.zsh-theme) theme for pentesters which includes the date, time, and IP address for pentest logging.

items.title: Awesome Security
items.content_text:
### Endpoint / Forensics

*   [Maigret (‚≠ê16k)](https://github.com/soxoj/maigret) - Maigret collect a dossier on a person by username only, checking for accounts on a huge number of sites and gathering all the available information from web pages.

items.title: Awesome Fantasy
items.content_text:

items.title: Awesome Appimage
items.content_text:
### AppImage consumption tools / Desktop integration

*   [AppImage-Integrator](https://github.com/w-j-r/AppImage-Integrator) - A simple program to integrate AppImages into the Linux desktop written in Qt6.
*   [gnome\_appimage\_installer (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/knork-fork/gnome_appimage_installer) - Somewhat a misnomer (AppImages don't need to be "installed"), creates a desktop file that follows the freedesktop.org spec for your AppImage files; written in bash.

### AppImage consumption tools / Package managers

*   [leap (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/lnxcz/leap) - Fast and simple AppImage manager. Written in Rust.

### AppImage developer tools / Tools to convert from other package formats

*   [Package-to-appimage (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/CausaPrincipalis71/package-to-appimage) - Tool for converting `.deb` and `.rpm` packages into AppImage format by using Docker.

### AppImage developer tools / Libraries

*   [appenv (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/TheMarlboroMan/appenv) - Small C++ library telling where the app data resides and where the user data is by using `readlink("/proc/self/exe")`), thus allowing C++ applications to become relocatable in the filesystem.
items.content_html:
AppImage consumption tools / Desktop integration

  • AppImage-Integrator - A simple program to integrate AppImages into the Linux desktop written in Qt6.
  • gnome_appimage_installer (‚≠ê3) - Somewhat a misnomer (AppImages don't need to be "installed"), creates a desktop file that follows the freedesktop.org spec for your AppImage files; written in bash.

AppImage consumption tools / Package managers

  • leap (‚≠ê12) - Fast and simple AppImage manager. Written in Rust.

AppImage developer tools / Tools to convert from other package formats

  • Package-to-appimage (‚≠ê4) - Tool for converting .deb and .rpm packages into AppImage format by using Docker.

AppImage developer tools / Libraries

  • appenv (‚≠ê0) - Small C++ library telling where the app data resides and where the user data is by using readlink("/proc/self/exe")), thus allowing C++ applications to become relocatable in the filesystem.

items.title: Awesome Cli Apps
items.content_text:
### Development / Chat

*   [rebound (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/shobrook/rebound) - Fetch Stack Overflow results on compiler error.
*   [bcal (‚≠ê658)](https://github.com/jarun/bcal) - Byte CALculator for storage conversions and calculations.
*   [bitwise (‚≠ê680)](https://github.com/mellowcandle/bitwise) - Base conversion and bit manipulation.
*   [cgasm (‚≠ê377)](https://github.com/bnagy/cgasm) - x86 assembly documentation.
*   [add-gitignore (‚≠ê695)](https://github.com/TejasQ/add-gitignore) - Interactively generate a .gitignore for your project based on your needs.
*   [is-up-cli (‚≠ê359)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-up-cli) - Check if a domain is up.
*   [reachable (‚≠ê37)](https://github.com/italolelis/reachable) - Check if a domain is up.
*   [loadtest (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/alexfernandez/loadtest) - Run load tests.
*   [diff2html-cli (‚≠ê565)](https://github.com/rtfpessoa/diff2html-cli) - Create pretty HTML from diffs.

### Development / Frontend Development

*   [surge](https://surge.sh) - Publish static websites for free.

### Development / Devops

*   [ipfs-deploy (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/agentofuser/ipfs-deploy) - Deploy static websites to [IPFS (‚≠ê23k)](https://github.com/ipfs/ipfs#overviewhttps://github.com/ipfs/ipfs#overview).
*   [Discharge (‚≠ê654)](https://github.com/brandonweiss/discharge) - Deploy static websites to Amazon S3.

### Development / HTTP Server

*   [serve (‚≠ê9.7k)](https://github.com/vercel/serve) - Serve static files (https, CORS, GZIP compression, etc).
*   [simplehttp (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/snwfdhmp/simplehttp) - Easily serve a local directory over HTTP.
*   [shell2http (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/msoap/shell2http) - Shell script based HTTP server.

### Development / HTTP Client

*   [HTTPie (‚≠ê36k)](https://github.com/httpie/httpie) - A user-friendly HTTP client.
*   [HTTP Prompt (‚≠ê9k)](https://github.com/eliangcs/http-prompt) - Interactive HTTP client featuring autocomplete and syntax highlighting.
*   [ain (‚≠ê614)](https://github.com/jonaslu/ain) - HTTP client with a simple format to organize API endpoints.

### Utilities / Calendars

*   [bitly-client (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/specious/bitly-client) - Bitly client.

### Data Manipulation / JSON

*   [gron (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/tomnomnom/gron) - Make JSON greppable.

### Data Manipulation / YAML

*   [dyff (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/homeport/dyff) - YAML diff tool.

### Files and Directories / Directory Listing

*   [lsd (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/Peltoche/lsd) - `ls` with many extra features.

### Images / Emoji

*   [imgur-uploader-cli (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/kevva/imgur-uploader-cli) - Upload images to imgur.
*   [pageres-cli (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/pageres-cli) - Capture website screenshots.
items.content_html:

  • bcal (‚≠ê658) - Byte CALculator for storage conversions and calculations.

  • diff2html-cli (‚≠ê565) - Create pretty HTML from diffs.
